item.title: Vizury monitors users on various screens to gain a better understanding of them
item.description: For marketers aiming to cultivate customer relationships, providing a consistent and tailored experience is crucial. In anticipation of ad:tech Tokyo, Vizury, a digital CRM company, has presented insights into developing a comprehensive cross-device targeting strategy. Understanding a user completely requires gathering data from various touchpoints such as desktop browsers, mobile websites, and apps. Vizury emphasizes that a successful cross-device strategy hinges on accurately identifying users across different devices. This allows marketers to track the customer journey from initial product view to the final purchase.

item.title: Cloud vs Premises Contact Center Costs
item.description: Lots of small businesses can get by with just a local or toll-free number for customer calls. But as companies grow, they usually dedicate staff and resources to handle customer interactions, creating a dedicated department known as a contact center. While contact centers are important, they can be expensive to run. Is there a way to reduce the cost? Until recently, outsourcing to different locations was an option, but that often led to issues with language barriers and inconsistent service quality.

item.title: ShoreTel Connect CLOUD Goes Way Beyond VoIP
item.description: VoIP phone systems are often viewed as a direct substitute for conventional analog business phone systems, encompassing Key Telephone and PBX systems. The transition to this modern technology eliminates the need for separate phone and computer networks and allows businesses to move their internal switching system to the cloud. Moreover, switching to IP phones unlocks a wider array of features, often referred to as Unified Communications (UC). ShorTel, a recognized leader in business communications, is widely used by companies of all sizes.

item.title: How Capital Starved Companies Upgrade Technology
item.description: Even with the economy recovering, securing funds for new technology can be challenging for businesses. Instead of traditional financing, consider “hosted solutions” or renting technology. This approach avoids large capital investments, allowing businesses to upgrade their systems affordably. Website hosting is a prime example. Initially, hosting your website on your servers made sense. However, with increased competition, affordable hosting services have become widely available, making it more practical to outsource this function.

item.title: StarHub introduces SmartUC service for businesses in Singapore, powered by Avaya
item.description: Avaya, a company that provides customer and team engagement solutions, partnered with StarHub, a Singaporean integrated infocommunications company, to launch SmartUC, a business communications service for Singaporean businesses. This service offers four main advantages: increased productivity, improved customer experience, product and service differentiation, and business expansion. Pamela Tham, Avaya’s Singapore Country Leader, highlighted the rapid evolution of customer and business user expectations, emphasizing the demand for mobile solutions, apps, social integration, cloud services, video conferencing, chat features, flexibility, user-friendliness, and instant access.

item.title: Monitoring social media shows the sentiments towards Formula One in the Asia Pacific region
item.description: In July, Microsoft launched Microsoft Social Listening in eight Asia Pacific markets. This service is designed to help professionals in sales, marketing, and customer care understand and engage with customers on social media more effectively. Microsoft Social Listening provides tools for analyzing market intelligence from social conversations, including sentiment analysis across multiple platforms. It also allows users to monitor products, brands, competitors, and campaigns globally in real time to gain a comprehensive understanding of their customers and their business in the social media landscape.

item.title: Customer Service Using Clouds and Social Networks
item.description: Exceptional customer service is crucial for any successful business. Retaining customers is more cost-effective than acquiring new ones, and positive customer experiences lead to organic promotion. Conversely, unhappy customers can significantly damage a company’s reputation, especially in today’s age of social media. Prioritizing excellent customer service brings rewards, while neglecting it leads to negative consequences. Implementing an efficient and user-friendly system that integrates modern communication channels like social media with traditional methods such as email and phone support is key.
